quest.name: Future Rust, Future Dust
journal: Beves is certain he has seen you somewhere before.
objectives: Question the people of Rhalgr's Reach.
Return the well-worn log to Beves.

dialogue.name: BEVES
dialogue.text: I-I-I beg your pardon? The womanman who bested Gaius van Baelsar wishes to offer me herhis assistance!?

dialogue.name: BEVES
dialogue.text: I say, this is highly irregular...though I have heard it said you had a penchant for aiding the common man. In which case...

dialogue.name: BEVES
dialogue.text: Before the occupation I was a humble historian. While my duties leave me scarce time for aught else, I think it important that these momentous events be recorded for the benefit of future generations.

dialogue.name: BEVES
dialogue.text: Primary sources are indispensable, and I had a mind to question a number of my fellow freedom fighters─ask them their motivations for taking up this cause and so forth.

dialogue.name: BEVES
dialogue.text: You may take down their statements in this log. And...Forename...thank you for your service. Now and ever after.

dialogue.name: BEVES
dialogue.text: It matters not what their reasons are, only that they are honest and forthright. This is for posterity's sake, after all.

dialogue.name: HROTMAR
dialogue.text: Why'd I join the Resistance? Well, if you must know...it was to avenge a friend the imperials butchered before my very eyes, back in Ala Mhigo.

dialogue.name: HROTMAR
dialogue.text: We owned a stall in the markets, and a passing soldier snatched up a piece of fruit. He spoke out before I could stop him, only to get a fulm of steel in the gut for his troubles. I found my way here, and that was that.

dialogue.name: ORELLA
dialogue.text: Why? Why indeed... To save lives, perhaps. Or to make amends for the ones I couldn't.

dialogue.name: ORELLA
dialogue.text: My father and my brothers were worked to death while building a castrum. What did it matter to the Garleans, eh? More where that lot came from. After that, I couldn't keep on doing nothing.

dialogue.name: HUGHOC
dialogue.text: Hm? Aren't you the eikon-slayer? Damned if I know why you'd bother asking someone like me why I joined the Resistance, but it's simple: if I wasn't fighting for Ala Mhigo, I'd be fighting for the Empire.

dialogue.name: HUGHOC
dialogue.text: You're either with 'em or not, and if you're with 'em, you may as well make the most of it. Food, training, citizenship if you live long enough. You'll die stealing someone else's land, like as not, but that's the choice. But me? I'd rather die here.

dialogue.name: AHELISSA
dialogue.text: I was just a cook before all this. Simple fare, really. Had a chance to lend a hand and help feed some refugees one day...

dialogue.name: AHELISSA
dialogue.text: I took a liking to the fighters. They...believed, you know? And there's always a need for cooks─or at least people who can work with whatever the foraging parties turn up...

dialogue.name: BEVES
dialogue.text: Well met, Forename. Have you spoken with the freedom fighters as I asked?

dialogue.name: BEVES
dialogue.text: Hmm... As fascinating as they are varied... You have a knack for convincing others to bare their hearts to you. I could not have done better myself.

dialogue.name: BEVES
dialogue.text: Many years from now, when these tempestuous times pass into memory, their accounts will serve as a window into the struggle. We must never forget, my friend. Never.
